intro: Ceratoides arborescens, commonly known as the tree sparrow's bill, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a woody stem that becomes more branched with age. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers appear in late summer. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
